golgui.utils

Class NumberAndSpaceFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.JFormattedTextField.AbstractFormatter
      • javax.swing.text.DefaultFormatter
        • javax.swing.text.InternationalFormatter
          • javax.swing.text.NumberFormatter
            • golgui.utils.NumberAndSpaceFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class NumberAndSpaceFormatter
extends javax.swing.text.NumberFormatter
    This is a extended NumberFormatter that allows only natural numbers and empty strings ("") as valid input.
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ANY_INPUT_ALLOWED
      Stands for a policy that user can input empty string but the empty string will automatically changed to 0.
      static int EMPTY_STRING_AND_NUM_ALLOWED
      Stands for a policy that the user is allowed to input anything.
      static int EMPTY_STRING_BECOME_ZERO
      Stands for a policy that user can input empty string and the empty string will stay as empty string.
      private int emptyStringPolicy
      true if the empty string stays as empty string, and false if empty string will be automatically changed to "0".
      static int ZERO_NOT_ALLOWED
      Stands for a policy that user can input empty string but the empty string will automatically changed to 1.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumberAndSpaceFormatter(java.text.NumberFormat format, int emptyStringPolicy)
      Creates a NumberAndSpaceFormatter with the specified Format instance, and sets allowed number to only natural numbers (0 included).

      • EMPTY_STRING_AND_NUM_ALLOWED

        public static final int EMPTY_STRING_AND_NUM_ALLOWED
        Stands for a policy that the user is allowed to input anything.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ZERO_NOT_ALLOWED

        public static final int ZERO_NOT_ALLOWED
        Stands for a policy that user can input empty string but the empty string will automatically changed to 1. And input of 0 is not allowed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • emptyStringPolicy

        private final int emptyStringPolicy
        true if the empty string stays as empty string, and false if empty string will be automatically changed to "0".

    • Constructor Detail

      • NumberAndSpaceFormatter

        public NumberAndSpaceFormatter(java.text.NumberFormat format,
                               int emptyStringPolicy)
        Creates a NumberAndSpaceFormatter with the specified Format instance, and sets allowed number to only natural numbers (0 included).
        Parameters:
        format - Format used to dictate legal values
        emptyStringPolicy - a flag stands for the policy that how the formatter treats an empty string
